meanings.definition: To enclose or surround in a womb.
meanings.sent1: The tiny seed was wombed in the rich soil, waiting to sprout.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird wombed her eggs in the cozy nest she built.
meanings.sent3: The curious kitten wombed itself in the empty box, pretending it was a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were wombed by the dense jungle, hiding their secrets from the world.
meanings.sent5: The old tree wombed countless creatures in its hollow trunk, providing shelter for generations.

meanings.definition: To give birth to or carry in the womb.
meanings.sent1: The queen bee wombed a new generation of bees in the hive.
meanings.sent2: The expectant mother wombed her precious baby for nine months.
meanings.sent3: The magical land wombed a rainbow after the storm, surprising all who saw it.
meanings.sent4: The artist's mind wombed brilliant ideas, ready to be born onto the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The fertile valley wombed fields of golden wheat, promising a bountiful harvest.
